title: Diploma in Financial Management for Managers
headline: Learn about the concepts of financial management that are essential for today's managers from this free online course.
description: Diploma in Financial Management for Managers is a free online course that teaches you the basic concepts and principles of finance and financial management. Learn about the techniques and processes essential for deciding on investment proposals for capital budgeting, estimating project cash flows, and computing the cost of capital for projects. Register for this course today and develop your career as a finance professional.

courseDescription:
Financial managers are responsible for the financial health of an organization. They produce financial reports, direct investment activities, and develop strategies and plans for the long-term financial goals of their organization. In this free online course from Alison, you will learn about the basic essentials that every finance manager needs to be equipped with. The Diploma in Financial Management for Managers course begins with an analysis of the major financial decision areas and the scope of financial management in practice.

Next, you will study the components of financial planning and the methods of forecasting the financial statements of an organization. The course then proceeds to an in-depth discussion on the concepts of time value of money and capital budgeting techniques. You will also learn about the principles and procedure involved in estimating project cash flows for capital budgeting decisions. The course also examines the techniques of risk analysis for the purpose of capital budgeting as well as the computation of the cost of capital (WACC). Finally, you will study the approaches and theories on capital structure, the impact of taxes on capital structure, and the determinants of a company's dividend policy.

This course reviews the roles of finance managers in depth along with a comprehensive guide to essential concepts in the world of finance and financial management. So, if you're interested in Finance as a career, or if you are a Finance professional looking to enhance your skills, or simply an individual with an interest in gaining knowledge of financial concepts, then check out this course today and start taking your career to the next level.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this diploma course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this diploma course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison diploma is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital diploma: a downloadable diploma in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked diploma, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked diploma in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All diploma are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison diploma, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison diploma, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our diploma pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn about the fundamental concepts of financial management from this module. You will study the important financial decision areas and the scope of financial management, along with the dynamic roles of financial managers.
topics: Fundamentals of Financial Management - Learning Outcomes
Fundamentals of Financial Management - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn more about the components of financial plans and forecasting financial statements from this module. You will also study methods of determining the external financing requirements, along with estimating the relevant growth rates.
topics: Financial Planning and Forecasting - Learning Outcomes
Financial Planning and Forecasting - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn more about the practical applications of the time value of money in financial management from this module. Get to study the present and future values of annuities and perpetuities, along with varying compounding periods.
topics: Time Value of Money - Learning Outcomes
Introduction to Time Value of Money
Future Value of A Single Amount
PV of Single Amounts and FV of an Annuity
PV of Growing Annuity and Perpetuity
Time Value of Money - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn about the processes involved in capital budgeting and the types of investment projects from this module. You will also learn about evaluating investment projects using the discounted and non-discounted investment criteria.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn about the discounting and non-discounting techniques for appraising investment proposals from this module. You will get to study the modified internal rate of return, payback period, and accounting rate of return techniques.
topics: Capital Budgeting Problems - NPV and IRR
Capital Budgeting Problems - Mutually Exclusive Projects

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Financial Management for Managers - First Assessment
modules.description: You must score 80% or more to pass this assessment.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn about the guidelines of the basic principles of project cash flow estimation from this module. You will also study the role of financial managers in estimating cash flows and the elements of the cash flow stream.
topics: Principles of Cash Flow Estimation - Learning Outcomes
Introduction to Estimation of Project Cash Flows
Role of Managers and Cash Flow Stream
Principles of Cash Flow Estimation - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn about estimating project cash flows for capital budgeting decisions from this module. You will also study the relevant cash flows for replacement proposals and ways of adjusting cash flows for inflation.
topics: Project Cash Flow Estimation - Learning Outcomes
Project Cash Flow Estimation - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn about the techniques of risk analysis for capital budgeting from this module. You will also study the use of diversification strategies in corporate risk analysis and the methods of project selection under risk.
topics: Risk Analysis for Capital Budgeting - Learning Outcomes
Risk Analysis for Capital Budgeting - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn about the methods of estimating the weighted average cost of capital from this module. You will also learn about determining the optimal capital budget schedule, along with adjusting for floatation costs.
topics: Divisional Cost of Capital and Flotation Costs

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn about various approaches to determining the optimal capital structure of a firm from this module. You will also study the Modigliani-Miller theory and other theories such as the signaling theory and the pecking order of financing.
topics: Optimal Capital Structure and Dividend Policy

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Financial Management for Managers - Second Assessment
modules.description: You must score 80% or more to pass this assessment.

modules.name: Module
topics: Diploma in Financial Management for Managers - Final Assessment
